business.name: HelloWorld
business.education_status: Just finished university (senior project due Friday from interview date)

monthly_revenue.note: Just graduating university, senior project not yet submitted

future_education_plans.challenge: Not available in Arab world/Lebanon, costs hundreds of thousands of dollars abroad

progress_assessment.main_blocker: Couldn't find good developers (too expensive or low quality)
progress_assessment.result: Slow progress but learned a lot

education_graduate_relief.label: accomplished_excited
evidence: Finished university last Friday
Senior project almost done
Plans to continue education (Master's)

cooperative_philosophy.label: deeply_passionate_convinced
evidence: Connections and relationships are more important than training, than funding, than anything
Not just 'we gave money and training' - people need ongoing support
Bloom shouldn't be transactional - you become Bloom Alumni, part of family forever
Warmth and humanity matter - we're not just imperialists or communists, we're human
Money is from Allah, what do I do with it to benefit others?

lebanon_economic_hardship.label: realistic_pressured
evidence: Lebanon situation is terrible - economically, socially, practically
Psychological pressure is tough
People around him not entrepreneurial, say he's wrong
Needs community of people like him to stay motivated

bloom_program_critique_constructive.label: grateful_but_suggests_improvements
evidence: Bloom was exceptional on time, funding, quality of trainers
BUT all accelerators have same weakness: give money + classes, assume that's enough
Doesn't work in countries with difficult economic conditions like Lebanon

bilal_conversation_gratitude.label: honored_energized
evidence: Bilal's baby Suleiman gives him energy
Honored to be consulted ('I'm taking notes, thanks for the ideas')
Excited about Paris meetup possibility

explicit_needs.evidence: Biggest problem I faced: finding developers. Most are too expensive or low quality. Forced to do everything myself. Not productive, progressing slowly
Wants to specialize in AI + Cyber Security. Bilal knows Mohammad Naja in Beirut working in this field
explicit_needs.bilal_action: Will find Mohammad Naja contact after call

explicit_needs.evidence: Domain (AI + Cyber Security) not available in Arab world/Lebanon. Needs scholarship for studies abroad (hundreds of thousands of dollars)

implied_needs.inference: Strong emphasis on community being more important than money. Needs ongoing connection to entrepreneurial community to counter isolation + negative environment in Lebanon
implied_needs.evidence: When you're with people like you, people putting in effort, it motivates you to continue. In society no one else is building projects like this

implied_needs.inference: Mentioned psychological pressure, tough economic conditions. Needs mental health support + community to sustain entrepreneurial journey

core_values.evidence: Connections and relationships are more important than training, more important than funding, more important than anything. This is THE thing that will have the most positive impact
Bloom shouldn't be 'we gave you money, bye'. No - you become Bloom Alumni Ezalden forever. You don't join a bank, get a check for $3K, and leave. You join a FAMILY. If the family has connections...
We shouldn't forget the human touch. We're social beings. Not just capitalism, not just communism - we're HUMAN. In the end it's rizq from Allah, what do I do with it to benefit others?
If you want professional support working alongside you during 4 months, you learn on the ground. After 4 months I've learned enough to know if someone new is working correctly or wasting money
By ourselves we're weak, together we can do something huge. 2016-now you have massive experience, they become like kohai (sempai/student relationship), 'I was like you Ezalden, I want to help you'

interest_level.label: champion_philosophical_advocate
evidence: Spent significant time articulating cooperative philosophy
Proposed specific models: lobby of Bloom companies, emergency fund (3% revenue pool)
Emphasized family/community over transactions
Criticized individualistic model, championed collective strength
interest_level.note: Ezalden IS the cooperative model's philosophical champion

co_design_contributions.description: Instead of just funding + sessions, allocate part of fund to hire professionals (marketing, finance, development) who WORK WITH founders during 4 months, not just teach
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Learning by doing > learning by listening. After 4 months under professional's guidance, founder can evaluate quality when hiring future help

co_design_contributions.description: Gather all Bloom companies (100+ that succeeded) into one lobby/collective. Together = powerful. Can support each other, share resources, create impact
co_design_contributions.reasoning: Absurd we haven't gathered them. Each alone = weak. Together = huge potential

co_design_contributions.description: Each successful company contributes 3% of revenue to shared pool. Acts like water tank - when one has surplus, when another has deficit, pool stabilizes everyone
co_design_contributions.mechanism: Revenue sharing into collective fund, redistributed as needed
co_design_contributions.precedent: Similar to business cooperatives/mutual aid societies

co_design_contributions.description: Every 2 months, conference/meetup in Beirut or elsewhere. Physical presence, not just Zoom. 'We need to preserve humanity, we're social beings'
co_design_contributions.anti_pattern: Everyone on Zoom with mic off, watching like a film, texting on WhatsApp
co_design_contributions.values: Human warmth, physical connection, mutual support

co_design_contributions.description: Bilal proposed: Bloom members earn Bloom coins, use them to hire each other (like Jad for marketing). Ezalden: 'Different from my idea but could work, interesting'

bloom_program_feedback.weakness: Assumes money + training = enough. Doesn't work in difficult economic contexts. Need ongoing professional support working WITH founders
bloom_program_feedback.suggestion: Embed professionals in startups during program, create ongoing community post-program

readiness_assessment.reasoning: HIGHEST values alignment in entire cohort - philosophical champion of cooperative model. BUT: Just graduated university, pre-revenue, no product launched yet. Better as cooperative CO-DESIGNER and future member than immediate pilot participant. His ideas should SHAPE the pilot even if he's not in first cohort.

support_needed: Mohammad Naja cyber security mentor intro (Bilal action item)
Bloom developer network access (solve his main blocker)
recommendation.unique_value: Philosophical depth, cooperative model champion, community-first thinking, spiritual/humanistic grounding
recommendation.special_note: Ezalden's IDEAS should shape the pilot even if he's not a participant yet. His 5 contributions are GOLD for cooperative design

specific_opportunities.description: Bilal knows Mohammad Naja in Beirut, works in cyber security (Ezalden's specialization)
specific_opportunities.action_required: Bilal finds contact info, makes intro

specific_opportunities.description: Ezalden's biggest blocker: can't find affordable, quality developers. Bloom has 1000+ teams, some are developers. Create vetted developer pool for Bloom members
specific_opportunities.mechanism: Bloom coins system (Bilal's idea) or cooperative rates for members
specific_opportunities.solves: Ezalden's main blocker + creates mutual aid infrastructure
specific_opportunities.action_required: Map Bloom network for developers, create directory + vetting system

specific_opportunities.description: Ezalden + Bilal agreed: gather all Bloom Lebanon alumni (2016-2024) for pizza, connections, mutual support
specific_opportunities.bilal_commitment: When I come to Beirut, let's gather people who want to meet, bring good pizza, discuss
specific_opportunities.ezalden_enthusiasm: Very honored, would love to meet, I'm in Nabatieh (South Lebanon) but can come to Beirut
specific_opportunities.action_required: Bilal: plan Beirut trip, send invite to Lebanon Bloom alumni

key_quotes.on_relationships: Connections and relationships are more important than training, more important than funding, more important than anything
key_quotes.on_community_vs_isolation: When you're with people like you, people putting in effort, it motivates you to continue. I'm alone - in general society no one is building projects like me, trying to open experiences this way. People tell me no you're wrong, you're not succeeding
key_quotes.on_bloom_as_family: You don't join a bank and get a $3000 check and leave. You join a FAMILY. And the family, if it has connections, it's natural it will support
key_quotes.on_humanity: We shouldn't forget to touch humanity. We're social beings at the end. It's not all capitalism, not all communism - we're HUMAN. You understand the idea?
key_quotes.on_collective_strength: By ourselves each one is weak, but together we can do something HUGE
key_quotes.on_wealth_purpose: In the end it's rizq from Allah. What do I do with it so it benefits?

meta_insights.unique_contribution: Philosophical anchor, cooperative model designer, values champion, spiritual/humanistic integration
meta_insights.special_status: Though not ready for pilot financially, Ezalden's IDEAS and VALUES should be foundational to cooperative design. Consult him as co-designer.
